name: Filesystem MCP
tagline: Give AI assistants secure access to your local filesystem
description: The Filesystem MCP server provides read/write access to local files and directories through the Model Context Protocol. It supports configurable access controls so you can limit which paths an AI assistant can reach, making it safe for daily use.

name: GitHub MCP
tagline: Interact with GitHub repos, issues, and PRs from your AI assistant
description: The GitHub MCP server connects AI assistants to the GitHub API, enabling operations like creating issues, reviewing pull requests, searching repositories, and managing branches. Perfect for AI-assisted development workflows.

name: Postgres MCP
tagline: Query and manage PostgreSQL databases through AI assistants
description: The Postgres MCP server provides read-only access to PostgreSQL databases, letting AI assistants inspect schemas, run queries, and help debug data issues. Designed with safety in mind, it defaults to read-only mode to prevent accidental mutations.

name: Brave Search MCP
tagline: Add web and local search capabilities to your AI assistant
description: The Brave Search MCP server integrates the Brave Search API, giving AI assistants the ability to perform web searches and local business lookups. Supports both general web queries and location-based searches with rich result formatting.

name: Puppeteer MCP
tagline: Let AI assistants browse and interact with web pages
description: The Puppeteer MCP server gives AI assistants browser automation capabilities through Puppeteer. It can navigate pages, take screenshots, click elements, fill forms, and extract content, enabling end-to-end web testing and scraping workflows.

name: Memory MCP
tagline: Persistent knowledge graph memory for AI assistants
description: The Memory MCP server provides a local knowledge graph that AI assistants can use to store and retrieve information across sessions. It creates entities, relations, and observations that persist as a JSON file, giving your AI long-term memory.

name: Sequential Thinking MCP
tagline: Structured step-by-step reasoning for complex AI problem solving
description: The Sequential Thinking MCP server provides a tool for dynamic, reflective problem-solving through a sequence of thought steps. It supports branching, revision, and flexible reasoning depth, helping AI assistants work through complex multi-step problems methodically.

name: Slack MCP
tagline: Connect AI assistants to Slack workspaces for messaging and channel management
description: The Slack MCP server enables AI assistants to read and send Slack messages, manage channels, and search conversation history. It uses the Slack Web API with Bot tokens and supports rich message formatting.

name: Google Drive MCP
tagline: Search and read Google Drive files from your AI assistant
description: The Google Drive MCP server provides search and read access to Google Drive, including Docs, Sheets, and Slides. It handles OAuth authentication and converts Google formats to readable text for AI processing.

name: Notion MCP
tagline: Read, search, and create Notion pages and databases from AI
description: The Notion MCP server connects AI assistants to the Notion API, enabling search across pages and databases, reading page content, creating new pages, and updating existing ones. Ideal for AI-assisted knowledge management workflows.

name: Linear MCP
tagline: Manage Linear issues and projects through AI assistants
description: The Linear MCP server provides AI assistants with access to Linear's project management platform. Create, update, and search issues, manage projects, and track team workflows directly from your AI coding assistant.

name: Sentry MCP
tagline: Investigate Sentry errors and performance issues with AI
description: The Sentry MCP server lets AI assistants query Sentry for error reports, stack traces, and performance data. Useful for debugging production issues by giving your AI assistant direct access to error monitoring data.

name: Cloudflare MCP
tagline: Manage Cloudflare Workers, KV, R2, and D1 from AI assistants
description: The Cloudflare MCP server provides AI assistants with access to Cloudflare's developer platform including Workers, KV Store, R2 storage, and D1 databases. Deploy and manage edge infrastructure through natural language.

name: Supabase MCP
tagline: Manage Supabase projects, databases, and edge functions via AI
description: The Supabase MCP server connects AI assistants to the Supabase management API, enabling database schema management, edge function deployment, and project configuration. Streamlines backend development with AI-assisted Supabase workflows.

name: Stripe MCP
tagline: Interact with the Stripe API for payments and billing through AI
description: The Stripe MCP server enables AI assistants to interact with Stripe's payments platform. Query customers, subscriptions, invoices, and payment intents, making it easier to debug billing issues and build payment integrations with AI assistance.

name: ripgrep
tagline: Blazingly fast recursive search that respects your .gitignore
description: ripgrep (rg) is a line-oriented search tool that recursively searches directories for a regex pattern. It is significantly faster than grep, ag, and ack, and automatically respects .gitignore rules. Built in Rust for maximum performance.

name: fd
tagline: A simple, fast, and user-friendly alternative to find
description: fd is a modern replacement for the Unix `find` command. It features intuitive syntax, colorized output, smart case sensitivity, regex and glob support, and automatic .gitignore respect. Written in Rust, it is significantly faster than find.

name: bat
tagline: A cat clone with syntax highlighting and Git integration
description: bat is a `cat` replacement that adds syntax highlighting for a large number of programming languages, Git integration to show modifications, automatic paging, and non-printable character display. Makes reading code in the terminal a pleasure.

name: eza
tagline: A modern replacement for ls with colors, icons, and Git awareness
description: eza is a modern, maintained replacement for the venerable `ls` command. It provides sensible defaults, colorized output, file type icons, Git status integration, tree view, and a host of formatting options. A community fork of the unmaintained exa.

name: delta
tagline: Beautiful syntax-highlighted diffs for Git and the terminal
description: delta is a viewer for git and diff output with syntax highlighting, line numbers, side-by-side view, and word-level diff highlighting. It integrates as a Git pager, making every `git diff` and `git log` output dramatically more readable.

name: zoxide
tagline: A smarter cd command that learns your habits
description: zoxide is a blazing-fast replacement for `cd` that remembers which directories you visit most. Type `z foo` and it jumps to the most frequently accessed directory matching 'foo'. Works with all major shells and integrates with fzf for interactive selection.

name: Starship
tagline: The minimal, blazing-fast, and customizable prompt for any shell
description: Starship is a cross-shell prompt written in Rust that is fast, highly customizable, and intelligent. It shows relevant information about your environment (Git branch, Node version, Python venv, etc.) and works with every major shell out of the box.

name: fzf
tagline: A general-purpose command-line fuzzy finder
description: fzf is an interactive filter program for any list. It integrates deeply with the shell, providing fuzzy file search (Ctrl+T), command history search (Ctrl+R), and directory jumping (Alt+C). An essential building block for productive terminal workflows.

name: jq
tagline: The command-line JSON processor
description: jq is a lightweight command-line JSON processor, like sed for JSON data. It allows you to slice, filter, map, and transform structured JSON data with a concise expression language. An indispensable tool for working with APIs and config files.

name: yq
tagline: A portable command-line YAML, JSON, and XML processor
description: yq is a lightweight command-line processor for YAML, JSON, XML, CSV, and TOML. It uses jq-like syntax to navigate and manipulate structured data. Essential for DevOps workflows involving Kubernetes manifests, Docker Compose files, and CI configs.

name: HTTPie
tagline: A user-friendly command-line HTTP client for the API era
description: HTTPie is designed to make CLI interaction with web services as human-friendly as possible. It provides intuitive syntax, JSON support by default, colorized output, sessions, and plugins. Available as both CLI (`http`/`https`) and a desktop app.

name: lazygit
tagline: A simple terminal UI for Git commands
description: lazygit provides a full-featured terminal user interface for Git. Stage files, resolve merge conflicts, cherry-pick commits, rebase interactively, and browse diffs all with keyboard shortcuts. Makes complex Git operations visual and approachable.

name: lazydocker
tagline: A simple terminal UI for Docker and Docker Compose
description: lazydocker provides a terminal UI for managing Docker containers, images, volumes, and networks. Monitor logs, view stats, restart containers, and manage Docker Compose stacks without remembering complex Docker CLI commands.

name: tmux
tagline: A terminal multiplexer for persistent, split-pane sessions
description: tmux lets you run multiple terminal sessions inside a single window, split panes horizontally and vertically, and detach/reattach sessions. The gold standard for remote development and persistent terminal workflows on Linux and macOS.

name: Zellij
tagline: A modern terminal multiplexer with batteries included
description: Zellij is a terminal workspace with a friendly UI, built-in layout system, plugin support via WebAssembly, and sensible defaults. It aims to be a more approachable alternative to tmux with discoverable keybindings and a status bar that shows available actions.

name: Atuin
tagline: Magical shell history with sync, search, and stats
description: Atuin replaces your existing shell history with a SQLite database and provides encrypted sync across machines. Full-text search, context-aware filtering (by directory, host, session), and statistics about your command usage patterns.

name: Nushell
tagline: A new type of shell that works with structured data
description: Nushell treats all input as structured data (tables, records, lists) rather than plain text streams. This makes filtering, sorting, and transforming data natural and composable. It combines the best ideas from shells, scripting languages, and data processing tools.

name: fish
tagline: A smart and user-friendly command line shell
description: fish (Friendly Interactive SHell) provides autosuggestions, syntax highlighting, tab completions, and a web-based configuration UI out of the box. It prioritizes discoverability and usability, making it an excellent shell for both beginners and power users.

name: dust
tagline: A more intuitive version of du written in Rust
description: dust (du + rust) gives you an instant overview of which directories are using disk space. It displays a visual bar chart of directory sizes, sorted from largest to smallest. Much faster and more readable than traditional `du` output.

name: hyperfine
tagline: A command-line benchmarking tool with statistical analysis
description: hyperfine runs a command multiple times and provides statistical analysis of execution times including mean, min, max, and relative standard deviation. It supports warmup runs, parameter sweeps, and export to various formats for comparing command performance.

name: Claude Code
tagline: An agentic coding tool that lives in your terminal
description: Claude Code is Anthropic's agentic coding assistant that operates directly in your terminal. It can read, write, and edit files, run commands, search codebases, and manage Git workflows. Powered by Claude, it handles complex multi-step coding tasks autonomously.

name: Cursor
tagline: The AI-first code editor built on VS Code
description: Cursor is a fork of VS Code with deeply integrated AI capabilities. It provides AI-powered code completion, multi-file editing with Composer, inline chat, and codebase-aware context. One of the most polished AI coding experiences available.

name: GitHub Copilot
tagline: AI pair programmer that suggests code as you type
description: GitHub Copilot provides AI-powered code suggestions directly in your editor, trained on billions of lines of public code. It supports inline completions, chat, and code explanations. The most widely adopted AI coding assistant with deep GitHub integration.

name: Continue
tagline: The open-source AI code assistant for any LLM
description: Continue is an open-source AI code assistant that connects to any LLM (Claude, GPT, Ollama, etc.) and integrates into VS Code and JetBrains. It provides tab autocomplete, inline editing, and chat with full codebase context. Highly configurable and model-agnostic.

name: Aider
tagline: AI pair programming in your terminal with Git integration
description: Aider is a terminal-based AI coding assistant that works with your local Git repo. It can edit multiple files, create commits with sensible messages, and works with Claude, GPT-4, and local models. Known for strong multi-file editing and its benchmark suite.

name: Open Interpreter
tagline: Let LLMs run code on your computer to complete tasks
description: Open Interpreter provides a natural language interface that runs code locally (Python, JavaScript, shell) to accomplish tasks. It can create files, browse the web, process data, and control your computer. A versatile local AI agent for general-purpose computing tasks.

name: Cody
tagline: AI coding assistant with deep codebase understanding from Sourcegraph
description: Cody by Sourcegraph is an AI coding assistant that uses Sourcegraph's code intelligence to understand your entire codebase. It provides context-aware completions, explanations, and code generation with the ability to reference code across repositories.

name: TabNine
tagline: AI code completion that runs locally or in the cloud
description: TabNine provides AI-powered code completions with support for local (on-device) and cloud-based models. It works across all major IDEs and supports dozens of programming languages. Offers privacy-focused options where code never leaves your machine.

name: Codeium
tagline: Free AI code completion and chat for 70+ languages
description: Codeium provides AI-powered autocomplete, search, and chat trained on a permissively licensed dataset. It supports over 70 programming languages and integrates with 40+ editors. The generous free tier makes it one of the most accessible AI coding tools.

name: v0
tagline: AI-powered UI generation by Vercel
description: v0 by Vercel generates React UI components from text and image prompts. It produces production-ready code using shadcn/ui and Tailwind CSS, with real-time preview and iterative refinement. Excellent for rapidly prototyping web interfaces.

name: bolt.new
tagline: Full-stack web app generation and deployment in your browser
description: bolt.new by StackBlitz lets you prompt, run, edit, and deploy full-stack web applications entirely in the browser. It uses WebContainers to run a full Node.js environment client-side, enabling instant AI-generated apps with no local setup required.

name: Devin
tagline: An autonomous AI software engineer by Cognition
description: Devin is an autonomous AI coding agent that can plan, write code, debug, and deploy software end-to-end. It operates in its own sandboxed environment with a shell, code editor, and browser, tackling complex engineering tasks with minimal human intervention.

name: SWE-agent
tagline: Open-source autonomous agent for solving GitHub issues
description: SWE-agent from Princeton NLP turns LLMs into software engineering agents that can fix real GitHub issues. It provides a custom agent-computer interface optimized for browsing repos, editing code, and running tests, achieving strong results on the SWE-bench benchmark.

name: OpenHands
tagline: Open-source platform for autonomous AI software agents
description: OpenHands (formerly OpenDevin) is an open-source platform for building AI agents that can write code, interact with command lines, and browse the web. It provides a sandboxed environment and supports multiple LLM backends for autonomous software development.

name: Windsurf
tagline: AI-powered IDE with agentic coding flows
description: Windsurf (formerly Codeium's editor) is an AI-first IDE built on VS Code that provides Cascade, an agentic coding flow that can reason across your codebase, make multi-file edits, and run terminal commands. Combines copilot-style completions with agent capabilities.

name: Supabase
tagline: The open-source Firebase alternative with Postgres at its core
description: Supabase provides a full backend platform built on PostgreSQL: database, auth, realtime subscriptions, edge functions, storage, and vector embeddings. Use the hosted service or self-host the entire stack with Docker. The fastest path from zero to production backend.

name: Coolify
tagline: An open-source, self-hostable Heroku/Netlify/Vercel alternative
description: Coolify is a self-hosted PaaS that lets you deploy applications, databases, and services to your own servers with a beautiful UI. It supports Docker, static sites, and major frameworks with automatic SSL, preview deployments, and GitHub integration.

name: Plausible
tagline: Privacy-friendly Google Analytics alternative
description: Plausible is a lightweight, open-source web analytics tool that is GDPR compliant by design. No cookies, no personal data collection, and a tiny ~1KB script. Provides all the essential metrics in a clean, simple dashboard.

name: Gitea
tagline: A painless, self-hosted Git service
description: Gitea is a lightweight, self-hosted Git platform with a GitHub-like interface. It includes issue tracking, pull requests, CI/CD (Gitea Actions), package registries, and project boards. Runs on minimal hardware and is easy to install and maintain.

name: Portainer
tagline: Container management made easy with a web UI
description: Portainer provides a beautiful web-based management UI for Docker, Docker Swarm, and Kubernetes. Deploy containers, manage stacks, monitor resources, and control access through a point-and-click interface. The easiest way to manage containerized infrastructure.

name: Uptime Kuma
tagline: A self-hosted monitoring tool like Uptime Robot
description: Uptime Kuma is a fancy self-hosted monitoring tool with a clean UI. It supports HTTP(s), TCP, DNS, Docker, and other monitoring types with notifications via Slack, Discord, Telegram, email, and 90+ other services. Beautiful status pages included.

name: n8n
tagline: Workflow automation tool with a visual builder and code flexibility
description: n8n is a fair-code workflow automation platform with 400+ integrations and a visual node-based editor. It supports complex branching logic, custom JavaScript/Python code nodes, webhooks, and can be self-hosted. Bridges the gap between no-code and full-code automation.

name: Directus
tagline: An instant REST and GraphQL API on top of any SQL database
description: Directus wraps any SQL database with a real-time GraphQL+REST API and provides a no-code data studio for managing content. It supports custom flows, role-based access, file storage, and webhooks. The open-source headless CMS and data platform for developers.

name: MinIO
tagline: High-performance S3-compatible object storage
description: MinIO is a high-performance, S3-compatible object storage system. It can run on bare metal, Docker, or Kubernetes and provides full S3 API compatibility, making it a drop-in replacement for Amazon S3 in self-hosted environments. Optimized for AI/ML workloads.

name: Traefik
tagline: A modern reverse proxy and load balancer for microservices
description: Traefik is a cloud-native reverse proxy that automatically discovers services and configures routing. It natively integrates with Docker, Kubernetes, and other orchestrators, provides automatic HTTPS via Let's Encrypt, and supports middleware for authentication, rate limiting, and more.

name: Caddy
tagline: A powerful web server with automatic HTTPS
description: Caddy is a modern web server that automatically obtains and renews TLS certificates. Its configuration is dramatically simpler than Nginx, with a human-readable Caddyfile format. Supports reverse proxying, load balancing, and static file serving out of the box.

name: Grafana
tagline: The open observability platform for metrics, logs, and traces
description: Grafana is the leading open-source platform for monitoring and observability dashboards. It connects to dozens of data sources (Prometheus, Loki, InfluxDB, PostgreSQL, etc.) and provides rich visualization, alerting, and exploration tools for operational data.

name: Prometheus
tagline: Open-source monitoring and alerting toolkit for cloud-native systems
description: Prometheus is the standard for metrics collection in cloud-native environments. It uses a pull-based model, stores time-series data efficiently, and provides PromQL for powerful queries. A CNCF graduated project and the backbone of modern infrastructure monitoring.

name: Authentik
tagline: Open-source identity provider with flows, policies, and SSO
description: Authentik is a self-hosted identity provider that supports SAML, OAuth2, OIDC, LDAP, and SCIM. It features a visual flow designer for authentication workflows, application proxying, and MFA. A comprehensive alternative to Auth0 and Okta for self-hosters.

name: Immich
tagline: Self-hosted photo and video management with AI features
description: Immich is a high-performance self-hosted photo and video backup solution with a mobile app. It features facial recognition, object detection, location-based browsing, automatic backups, and shared albums. The best open-source Google Photos alternative.

name: Raycast
tagline: A blazingly fast, extendable launcher for macOS productivity
description: Raycast is a macOS launcher that replaces Spotlight with a powerful, extensible command palette. It includes clipboard history, window management, snippets, a built-in AI assistant, and a rich extension store with 1000+ community integrations for developer tools.

name: Warp
tagline: The modern terminal with AI built in
description: Warp is a GPU-accelerated terminal with AI command search, block-based output, collaborative features, and a modern text editor feel. It supports natural language command generation and provides IDE-like features (completions, highlighting) in a terminal context.

name: Amazon Q Developer
tagline: AI-powered developer assistant with terminal autocomplete (formerly Fig)
description: Amazon Q Developer (formerly Fig) provides AI-powered autocomplete for the terminal, chat-based coding assistance, and code transformation capabilities. The terminal autocomplete adds IDE-style suggestions to any CLI tool in your existing terminal.

name: Hoppscotch
tagline: Open-source API development ecosystem
description: Hoppscotch is a lightweight, web-based API development tool supporting REST, GraphQL, WebSocket, SSE, Socket.IO, and MQTT. It features collections, environments, pre-request scripts, and team collaboration. A fast, open-source alternative to Postman.

name: Bruno
tagline: Open-source API client that stores collections in your Git repo
description: Bruno is an offline-first API client that stores collections directly in a folder on your filesystem using a plain-text markup language (Bru). This means API collections live alongside your code in Git. No cloud sync needed, no account required.

name: Insomnia
tagline: The collaborative API development platform
description: Insomnia is an API client for REST, GraphQL, gRPC, and WebSocket with a focus on design-first development. It supports OpenAPI spec design, automated testing, environment variables, and Git sync for collaborative API workflows.

name: TablePlus
tagline: Modern, native database management GUI
description: TablePlus is a native database management tool with a clean UI that supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, Redis, MongoDB, and many more. Features include inline editing, query history, multi-tab interface, and dark mode. Fast and polished on every platform.

name: Beekeeper Studio
tagline: Open-source SQL editor and database manager
description: Beekeeper Studio is a cross-platform SQL editor and database manager with a clean, modern interface. It supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, SQL Server, CockroachDB, and more. Features autocomplete, query history, table filtering, and a beautiful dark theme.

name: DevToys
tagline: A Swiss Army knife for developers - offline utilities collection
description: DevToys bundles 30+ offline developer utilities into a single app: JSON formatter, JWT decoder, Base64 encoder, UUID generator, hash calculator, regex tester, color picker, and more. Works completely offline with a clean native interface.

name: Zed
tagline: A high-performance, multiplayer code editor from the creators of Atom
description: Zed is a next-generation code editor built from scratch in Rust for maximum performance. It features real-time collaboration, integrated AI assistance, Tree-sitter for syntax highlighting, and GPU-accelerated rendering. From the team behind Atom and Electron.

name: Helix
tagline: A post-modern modal text editor with built-in LSP support
description: Helix is a terminal-based modal text editor inspired by Kakoune and Vim. It provides built-in Language Server Protocol support, Tree-sitter integration for syntax highlighting, and multiple selections as a core primitive. No plugin system needed for basics.

name: Neovim
tagline: Hyperextensible Vim-based text editor with Lua scripting
description: Neovim is a modern refactor of Vim with built-in LSP client, Tree-sitter integration, Lua scripting, and an async plugin architecture. It is the foundation for a massive ecosystem of plugins and distributions (LazyVim, AstroNvim, NvChad) that create full IDE experiences.

name: WezTerm
tagline: A GPU-accelerated terminal emulator configured with Lua
description: WezTerm is a GPU-accelerated cross-platform terminal emulator and multiplexer written in Rust. It is configured entirely in Lua, supports ligatures, image rendering, multiplexing (like tmux built-in), and has excellent cross-platform consistency.

name: Alacritty
tagline: The fastest terminal emulator, GPU-accelerated and minimal
description: Alacritty is a cross-platform, GPU-accelerated terminal emulator that prioritizes simplicity and performance above all. It uses a TOML config file, supports Vi mode for scrollback navigation, and is intentionally minimal, delegating features like tabs to tmux or Zellij.

name: Kitty
tagline: A fast, feature-rich GPU-accelerated terminal emulator
description: Kitty is a GPU-accelerated terminal emulator that uses OpenGL for rendering. It supports image display (via its graphics protocol), ligatures, tabs, splits, remote control via IPC, and extensibility through kittens (small Python programs). Highly customizable and performant.
